meanings.definition: Exaggerated or extravagant claims made to promote or advertise something.
meanings.sent1: The hypes about the new product were everywhere in the store.
meanings.sent2: The company's marketing team created hypes to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The hypes about the magic beans were so over-the-top that no one believed them.
meanings.sent4: The hypes surrounding the concert were like a loud drumbeat that drew in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The hypes painted a picture of a world full of wonders and excitement.

meanings.definition: To promote or publicize something in an exaggerated or extravagant way.
meanings.sent1: She hypes up the event to make it sound like the best party ever.
meanings.sent2: The company hypes their new product to increase sales.
meanings.sent3: He hypes his cooking skills, but we'll see if he can really make a good meal.
meanings.sent4: The speaker hypes the audience with his powerful words.
meanings.sent5: The coach hypes the team before the big game to boost their confidence.
